item.Name: Use 3rd Person Camera When Active
Hide Reticle When Active
Is Motion Tracked (By Enemies) When Active
One-Shot Activation Effect#Effect kills itself rather than being explicitly killed when the ability deactivates
Can be activated when weapon state is relaxed
Does Not Appear In Extended Motion Tracker Range

_field_real_fraction.name: activation energy cost#amount of energy required to activate the ability

_field_real.name: active energy consumption:energy/second#amount of energy consumed continuously while the ability is active

_field_tag_reference_64.name: activation effect#effects triggered when player activates ability

item.Name: Lock Gaze
Custom Sprint Anim When Ready
Evading Breaks Aim Assist
Disable Soft Contacts

_field_real_fraction.name: sprint speed fraction threshold#shoulder bash can only be activated once sprint speed fraction clears this threshold

_field_real.name: bash speed:world units per second#speed at which the character moves during the shoulder bash
target speed scalar#multiplier on top of 'bash speed' if the player has a target
bash duration:seconds[0.01,+inf]#duration that the bash will last
bash duration with target:seconds[0.01,+inf]#duration that the bash will last if the player has a target

_field_custom.name: target range scalar#scales the range at which aim assist picks up a target and puts an additional scale on how fast we bash towards a target

_field_struct.name: target range scalar#scales the range at which aim assist picks up a target and puts an additional scale on how fast we bash towards a target

_field_real.name: Base Value

item.Name: sequential#applies the percentages one after another on the base
total percentage#adds up all of the percentages and applies them to the base
addition#adds on all of the modifiers to the base
product#multiplies the values one after another on to the base

_field_real.name: yaw speed scale#scale applied to player's look yaw speed while shoulder bashing
pitch speed scale#scale applied to player's look pitch speed while shoulder bashing
off the ground tolerance#height above which airborne mode should be used (bash direction flattened)
hit sphere offset x:wu#how much in front of the character the hit sphere should be placed
hit sphere offset z:wu#how high the hit sphere should be placed relative to the character origin
hit sphere radius:wu
hit sphere start point offset:wu#how far back from the sphere position to start the moving sphere hit test (should be positive, default = 0.25)
surface adhesion velocity:wu/s#used to stop the character from launching off ramps (default = 0.5)
surface adhesion airborne time limit:seconds#continue to try applying the adhesion velocity for this long after leaving the ground (default = 0.1)

_field_angle.name: maximum shoulder bash assist angular velocity:degrees/second#maximum angular velocity that can be introduced by the shoulder bash assist system
assist pitch angle min:degrees#how much below the bash plane you are allowed to deviate
assist pitch angle max:degrees#how much above the bash plane you are allowed to deviate
contact angle threshold for damage:degrees#contact normal for objects hit during bash must be within this angle of bash direction in order for damage to be applied to the object

_field_real.name: contact ignore offset#ignore contacts that are below this offset (in z) above the characters' origin

_field_angle.name: bash direction pitch offset for damage:degrees#The pitch offset from bash direction to force an upwards lift

_field_custom.name: knockback scalar#scales knockback (instantaneous acceleration) effects caused by shoulder bash

_field_struct.name: knockback scalar#scales knockback (instantaneous acceleration) effects caused by shoulder bash

_field_real.name: Base Value

item.Name: sequential#applies the percentages one after another on the base
total percentage#adds up all of the percentages and applies them to the base
addition#adds on all of the modifiers to the base
product#multiplies the values one after another on to the base

plugin._field_explanation: Use this curve to define how the camera pitch tilts when the character shoulder bashes. The x axis measures time from the beginning of the bash to the end. Y axis is angle (in degrees) that the camera is pitched in the direction of the bash.

Use this curve to define how the camera is offset forward when the character shoulder bashes. The x axis measures time from the beginning of the bash to the end. Y axis is distance (in wu) that the camera is offset in the direction of the bash. NOTE: This is necessary because the character's body tilts forward during the shoulder bash. It should be used to match the camera position to that tilt, not to exaggerate the feeling of motion.

Use this curve to define how the camera FOV changes when the character shoulder bashes. The x axis measures time from the beginning of the bash to the end. Y axis is the amount (in degrees) that the FOV is modified at the given time. Negative numbers shrink the FOV, positive numbers grow it.

_field_tag_reference_64.name: bash damage effect#damage applied to the thing that gets shoulder bashed
bash clang damage effect#damage applied to the thing that gets shoulder bashed
bash effect#created on the thing that gets shoulder bashed
bash response damage effect#applied to character that performed the bash to generate rumble and other such effects
bash response effect#created on the character performed the bash

_field_custom.name: damage scalar#scales the damage multiplier on damage events caused by shoulder bash

_field_struct.name: damage scalar#scales the damage multiplier on damage events caused by shoulder bash

_field_real.name: Base Value

item.Name: sequential#applies the percentages one after another on the base
total percentage#adds up all of the percentages and applies them to the base
addition#adds on all of the modifiers to the base
product#multiplies the values one after another on to the base

_field_string_id.name: shoulder bash animation#the animation played when the shoulder bash is triggered
shoulder bash success follow-through#animation played when the character bashes an object that it can damage

_field_real.name: shoulder bash success follow-through duration#how long to play the animation (assumes it has loop markers)
shoulder bash success follow-through FP camera restore time#relative to end of duration above

_field_string_id.name: shoulder bash success rebound#animation played when the character bashes an object that it can damage and rebounds

_field_real.name: shoulder bash success rebound duration#how long to play the animation (assumes it has loop markers)
shoulder bash success rebound FP camera restore time#relative to end of duration above
shoulder bash success rebound speed duration:seconds
shoulder bash success rebound speed:wu/s

plugin._field_explanation: materials listed here will prevent the rebound from occurring.

_field_string_id.name: shoulder bash miss follow-through#animation played when the character hits nothing)

_field_real.name: shoulder bash miss follow-through FP camera restore time

_field_real_fraction.name: shoulder bash miss follow-through early out fraction#once the animation is more than this percentage through allow an early exit if the player is trying to move

_field_angle.name: auto aim angle:degrees#the maximum angle that auto aim works at full strength

_field_real.name: auto aim range:world units#the maximum distance that auto aim works at full strength
auto aim falloff range:world units#at what point the auto aim starts falling off
auto aim near falloff range:world units#at what point the auto aim reaches full power

_field_short_enum.name: bash AI sound level#intensity of AI sound notification

item.Name: silent#ai will not respond to this sound
quiet
medium
shout
loud#ai can hear this sound at any range
